Articles.Content:
It has to be 'fully assembled' when I get to Eve, but obviously I can't put 5000 ore in it in the Construction. It has to be one launch.

I have a 'Digger' on Gilly already, and can carry 5000 units of Ore in two or three loads. My question is, if I dock that Digger, does that violate the terms of 'fully assembled', since it'll be coming from a docked craft? For that matter, if I get one load with 5000 units, does it cancel the contract when it docks, before I can transfer anything?

There's a old reddit post that says: 

"I believe it just means you can't use an engineer to assemble part of it in orbit. Like putting the solar panels on after launching a module into orbit. You can still build it with multiple launches, just dont use the EVA assembly feature to put parts on like the antenna or solar panels the contract requires, launch it with them already on."

with a reply 

"This is correct; I just verified myself. If anyone else stumbles on this discussion like I did, there's your answer."

 

 

ref:

Seriously?!

There's an answer I wish I had five contracts ago.
